description: A KCM template to deploy a K8s managed cluster (EKS) on AWS

addons.description: The EKS addons to enable with the EKS cluster

configuration.description: Optional configuration of the EKS addon in YAML format

conflictResolution.description: ConflictResolution is used to declare what should happen if there are parameter conflicts. Defaults to none

serviceAccountRoleARN.description: ServiceAccountRoleArn is the ARN of an IAM role to bind to the addons service account

version.description: The version of the addon to use

associateOIDCProvider.description: Automatically create an identity provider for the controller for use with IAM roles for service accounts

clusterAnnotations.description: Annotations to apply to the cluster

clusterIdentity.description: A reference to an identity to be used when reconciling the managed control plane

clusterLabels.description: Labels to apply to the cluster

pods.description: The network ranges from which Pod networks are allocated

services.description: The network ranges from which service VIPs are allocated

eksClusterName.description: The name of the EKS cluster in AWS. If unset, the default name will be created based on the namespace and name of the managed control plane

kubeProxy.description: Managed attributes of the kube-proxy daemonset

disable.description: Disable set to true indicates that kube-proxy should be disabled. With EKS clusters kube-proxy is automatically installed into the cluster

oidcIdentityProviderConfig.description: The oidc provider config to be attached with this eks cluster

publicIP.description: Specifies whether the instance should get a public IP

region.description: AWS region to deploy the cluster in

sshKeyName.description: The name of the key pair to securely connect to your instances. Valid values are empty string (do not use SSH keys), a valid SSH key name, or omitted (use the default SSH key name)

vpcCni.description: The configuration options for the VPC CNI plugin

disable.description: Indicates that the Amazon VPC CNI should be disabled

env.description: A list of environment variables to apply to the aws-node DaemonSet

worker.description: The configuration of the worker machines

amiID.description: The ID of Amazon Machine Image

iamInstanceProfile.description: A name of an IAM instance profile to assign to the instance

baseOS.description: The name of the base operating system to use for image lookup the AMI is not set

format.description: The AMI naming format to look up the image for this machine. It will be ignored if an explicit AMI is set

org.description: The AWS Organization ID to use for image lookup if AMI is not set

instanceType.description: The type of instance to create. Example: m4.xlarge

nonRootVolumes.description: Configuration options for the non root storage volumes, format: https://pkg.go.dev/sigs.k8s.io/cluster-api-provider-aws/v2/api/v1beta2#AWSMachineSpec.NonRootVolumes
nonRootVolumes.title: Non-root storage volumes

rootVolumeSize.description: Specifies size (in Gi) of the root storage device. Must be greater than the image snapshot size or 8 (whichever is greater)

uncompressedUserData.description: Specify whether the user data is gzip-compressed before it is sent to ec2 instance. Cloud-init has built-in support for gzip-compressed user data. User data stored in aws secret manager is always gzip-compressed

workersNumber.description: The number of the worker machines
